description: Check what is happening to healthcare for UK nationals visiting, living in or moving to the EU

details.body: If you’re visiting, living in or moving to an EU or EEA country, you can use this tool to find out how to register for and access healthcare.

nodes.body: As well as the 27 EU member states, this guidance also covers Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Switzerland.

options.label: I’m visiting an EU country, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway or Switzerland
I live, work or study in or am moving to an EU country, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway or Switzerland

nodes.title: Are you visiting or living in an EU country?
Which country are you living, working or studying in, or moving to?

nodes.body:
Your European Health Insurance Card (EHIC) or Global Health Insurance Card (GHIC) will be valid if you’re travelling to an EU country.

Find out more about GHIC.

Visiting Switzerland

There are different rules for using your GHIC or EHIC card in Switzerland.

To use your GHIC or EHIC in Switzerland, you must be one of the following:

  • a British national
  • a Swiss national
  • an EU citizen
  • a refugee
  • a stateless person
  • the dependant or survivor of someone with one of these nationalities or statuses

You may need to show evidence of your nationality if you access healthcare using your GHIC or EHIC.

Visiting Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein

Get appropriate travel insurance with healthcare cover before you travel. Make sure it covers any pre-existing conditions that were previously covered by your European Health Insurance Card (EHIC).

You can use a UK passport to get medically necessary healthcare in Norway (for example emergency treatment, or to treat a pre-existing condition).

You can read advice on buying travel insurance with the right cover.

UK-issued EHICs

Some people can apply for a UK EHIC that they can use in EU countries, Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Switzerland. People who can apply for the card include:

  • UK students who started studying in the EU before 1 January 2021
  • some British State Pensioners who were living in the EU before 1 January 2021, and their families
  • EU nationals who were living in the UK before 1 January 2021, and their families

Find out more about the new UK EHIC.
nodes.title: Visiting the EU

nodes.body:
You will have to meet local immigration and residency rules before you can register for state healthcare.

For more information, read a guide to healthcare for UK nationals in Austria.

The rest of the links on this page lead to sections of that guide about healthcare in Austria.

Living and working in Austria

Read the section of the healthcare guide about living and working in Austria.

UK State Pension holders: using an S1 in Austria

If you have a UK State Pension you may be able use an S1 form to get UK-funded state healthcare in Austria.

Read the section of the healthcare guide about getting an S1 and using it in Austria.

Working in Austria temporarily (‘posted workers’)

Read the section of the healthcare guide about posted workers.

Studying in Austria

Read the section of the healthcare guide for students.
